docs.lead_paragraph: ONCE when I was climbing a hill in Uganda I came upon a small creeping plant starred with tiny yellow flowers. "That's the toothache plant," said my companion, a trained botanist. Witch doctors, he explained, used an infusion of the flower to treat toothache.

headline.main: Science, Psychiatry -- or Witchery?; An effort is being made to find out what, if anything, the witch doctor does for his patients that might be of value for the rest of the world.

docs.abstract: E Huxley article on witch practices
